page.title: 04 COPLEY HILL
page.content: COPLEY HILL FARM - 390 acres. Privately owned. There are 6 houses on the farm, owned by the farmer and rented mainly to his workers. There are 10 adults and 5 children in residence. 23 acres are taken up by deciduous woodland, mainly ash, sycamore and beech, although many beech trees died of fungal disease in recent years. In 1920 the area was used mainly for sheep farming, with poor soil, which was infested with rabbits. The soil improved with the help of modern fertilisers, to become used more for arable crops.{ LOCAL HISTORY A Tumulus (Roman Burial Mound) is Copley Hill. A Roman Road runs on the northern boundary of the farm. Remains of a Roman Villa are present, but only become apparent when seen from the air.
